snippet: Mawlawi Haibatullah Akhundzada, seen as a potential unifier, remains something of a mystery at the top of an insurgency stretched by internal divisions....
abstract: Little is known about new Taliban leader Mawlawi Haibatullah Akhundzada, religious scholar seen as potential unifier who had modest upbringing and maintained low-key profile for decades.

byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Zahra Nader contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Mawlawi Haibatullah Akhundzada, seen as a potential unifier, remains something of a mystery at the top of an insurgency stretched by internal divisions.

headline.main: Taliban’s New Leader, More Scholar Than Fighter, Is Slow to Impose Himself
headline.print_headline: Taliban’s New Leader, More Scholar Than Fighter, Remains a Mystery
